to get money, food, etc. from other people, especially without working for it or doing anything to deserve it: I don't want to leech off my parents any longer. Billions of pounds were being leeched from developing countries by tax avoidance.
More examplesFewer examplesFrank still lives with his mother, while Rick leeches off his father.That was the only time that I have truly felt like a parasite because I felt I was leeching from people.The 90% of the audience who leeched and freeloaded, who contributed nothing to the show, got exactly what they deserved: nothing.
